timeline.bodyText:
I've changed the default level to NONE.

it is consistent with track1
I think NONE should be the default.
timeline.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Always a potential security risk if print out too many things. It is less risky for track2 log, since by default only a few header/query is white-listed.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

timeline.bodyText: Javadoc to notify that this will take precedence if set.
timeline.author: weidongxu-microsoft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -18,12 +19,23 @@
 public interface AzureConfigurable<T extends AzureConfigurable<T>> {
 
     /**
-     * Set the logging level on the HTTP client.
+     * Set the logging options on the HTTP client.
      *
-     * @param level the HttpLogDetailLevel logging level
+     * @param logOptions the HttpLogDetailLevel logging options
      * @return the configurable object itself
      */
-    T withLogOptions(HttpLogOptions level);
+    T withLogOptions(HttpLogOptions logOptions);
+
+    /**
+     * Sets the logging detail level on the HTTP client.
+     *
+     * If set, this configure will override {@link HttpLogOptions#setLogLevel(HttpLogDetailLevel)} configure of

timeline.message: add a NPE guard for logOptions
